titles.title: Fairness in Federal Contracting Act of 2011
Fairness in Federal Contracting Act of 2011
To amend title 41, United States Code, to prohibit executive agencies from requiring the disclosure of political contributions by an entity submitting an offer for a Federal contract.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Oversight and Government Reform.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Technology, Information Policy, Intergovernmental Relations and Procurement Reform .

committee.name: House Oversight and Accountability
committee.subcommittee: Technology, Information Policy, Intergovernmental Relations and Procurement Reform

bill.summary: Fairness in Federal Contracting Act of 2011 - Prohibits an executive agency from requiring an entity that is bidding on a federal contract or otherwise participating in the acquisition of property or services from the federal government to disclose information on any payments to a candidate for federal office or to a political committee or on any disbursements for such purposes, as a condition for submitting such contract bid or for participating in the acquisition of property or services.
